snippet: The death of Vice President Muhammad Qasim Fahim, who played a crucial role in ousting the Taliban, created a rift in the political power structure less than a month before Afghans were to elect a new leader.
abstract: Afghan Vice Pres Muhammad Qasim Fahim, formidable power broker and former warlord who played crucial role in ousting Taliban and shaping the political order that followed, dies less than a month before Afghans are to elect new leader; death creates rift in Afghan power structure, removing crucial player from factional and ethnic landscape as well as cabinet politics.

byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar and Hares Kakar contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The death of Vice President Muhammad Qasim Fahim, who played a crucial role in ousting the Taliban, created a rift in the political power structure less than a month before Afghans were to elect a new leader.

headline.main: Warlord Who Tamped Conflicts as Afghan Vice President Dies
headline.print_headline: Warlord Who Tamped Conflicts as Afghan Vice President Dies
